critique: The document is a legal order transferring electric transmission facilities and substation facilities from the War Department to the Tennessee Valley Authority. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is likely a sense of confidence and assurance that the government is efficiently managing resources and infrastructure for the benefit of the public. The tone is formal and authoritative, aiming to convey competence and control. There is a secondary emotion of joy that the Tennessee Valley Authority will be able to use the facilities for its purposes as stated in the Tennessee Valley Authority Act of 1933.
